newsitem.title: USA: Couple urges Suburban to repurchase stock.
newsitem.headline: Couple urges Suburban to repurchase stock.

text.p: Connecticut investors Jerome and Susan Davis said Thursday they had advised Suburban Bancorp to consider a stock repurchase in view of the current bid for common stock below its "book value".
In a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission, the couple said, "This buyback opportunity is the result of and necessitated by Suburban's consistently poor financial performance."

In a December 12 letter to Suburban President Joseph Hutchinson, the couple wrote "...it would be folly, negligent, reckless and clearly in breach of your fiduciary duty not to take advantage of the poor position in which you have placed the bank."
In the letter, the couple said the bank is in a position to increase its book value by buying back shares at $15 to $15.50 a share.
As of September 30, the book value of the common stock was set at $17.76 per share.
According to the filing, the letter followed a telephone conversation between Jerome Davis and Hutchinson in which the bank president told the investor of his opposition to a stock repurchase.
Davis and his wife hold a 5.95 percent stake in Suburban's common stock, or 87,800 common shares.
Suburban, based in Cincinnati, is a bank holding company for Federal Savings Bank.
